In Windows 7:
Setting Helvetica-Black => ArialBlack fixes most yellow texts, the white text near Paul & Elisabeth, the white texts with "queen", "twin", and the blue "1", "2" and "3".
Setting HelveticaNeue-Black => ArialBlack fixes the yellow "Until 2001!"
Setting HelveticaNeue-Heavy => ArialBlack fixes the yellow "call toll free"

jahewson: can you add these mappings somewhere?

The built-in mappings are for Standard 14 fonts only. Any other substitution needs to be done by our generic mechanisms, rather than being hardcoded.

Bold fonts don't have a flag in the FontDescriptor, so we use the following heuristic in getFallbackFontName() to detect them:

isBold = fontDescriptor.getFontName().toLowerCase().contains("bold");

We could change this to:

String name = fontDescriptor.getFontName().toLowerCase();
isBold = name.contains("bold") || name.contains("black") || name.contains("heavy")
